//notes: the version with the charging handle and the BCG in the same package
if ever the weight of this upper is recalculated from constituent parts, these are likely the components for the upper

variants.description: A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 16-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, an unremarkable bolt carrier group, a BREACH changing handle, and a MOD 4 M-LOK handguard with a full top rail sitting flush with the upper receiver itself.  <variant:black>

A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 16-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, an unremarkable bolt carrier group, a BREACH changing handle, and a MOD 4 M-LOK handguard with a full top rail sitting flush with the upper receiver itself.  <variant:olive>

A complete upper receiver assembly for AR-15-style firearms.  Includes a 16-inch barrel chambered in 5.56mm NATO, an unremarkable bolt carrier group, a BREACH changing handle, and a MOD 4 M-LOK handguard with a full top rail sitting flush with the upper receiver itself.  <variant:brown>

notes: trim is only for the part where the barrel sticks ahead of the handguard
while not the most accurate, we model the upper as a cylinder based on the handguard's stated outer diameter, presuming that the uneven parts even out throughout the model

//integral_longest_side: on average, an AR-15 lower receiver has exactly 7 in. = 177.8 mm of space for an upper receiver
//add_mod: no slot for bayonet lug because the handguard leaves no space to attach a bayonet
only one slot for rail attachments because only the top rail exists on this handguard
two rail mount slots added here to model the handguard realistically
slot for underbarrel replaced with slot for underbarrel mount because there's no bottom rail on the handguard
